put.description: This endpoint allows the country editor to upload patient data for given TXM event. TXM event name has to be provided by an ADMIN. You can either add patients to the current dataset or remove all patients from respective country in case there were any. To access this endpoint one has to have credentials to service account and obtain jwt token via the login endpoint.

200.description: Login successful. JWT generated. User must attach the token to every request in the "Authorization" header with the prefix "Bearer". Example: "Authorization: Bearer some_token", where some_token is the token received in the response.

post.description: Endpoint to be used for login of users. Returns JWT. This JWT serves two purposes: in the case of normal accounts it can be used to obtain OTP at the /otp endpoint; in the case of service accounts it can be directly used to access /public/patient-upload endpoint

txm_event_name.description: The TXM event name has to be provided by an ADMIN.

add_to_existing_patients.description: If *true* the currently uploaded patients will be added to the patients already in the system. If *false* the data in the system will be overwritten by the currently uploaded data.

medical_id.description: Medical ID of the patient. This ID is unique thorough the system and can be used for the identification of a specific patient in your system. Typically, this is the patient ID used in your internal system.

hla_typing.description: HLA typing of the patient. Use high resolution if available.

related_recipient_medical_id.description: Medical ID of the related recipient, empty for bridging and non-directed donors.

height.description: Height of the patient in centimeters.

weight.description: Weight of the patient in kilograms.

year_of_birth.description: Year of birth of the patient.

internal_medical_id.description: Custom medical ID that will not be shown in UI, but will be stored and can be seen in patient xlsx export.

hla_antibodies.description: Detected HLA antibodies of the patient. Use high resolution                                   if available. If high resolution is provided it is assumed that all tested antibodies were provided. If not it is assumed that either all or just positive ones were.

acceptable_blood_groups.description: Acceptable blood groups for the patient. Leave empty to use                                             compatible blood groups.

medical_id.description: Medical ID of the patient. This ID is unique thorough the system and can be used for the identification of a specific patient in your system. Typically, this is the patient ID used in your internal system.

hla_typing.description: HLA typing of the patient. Use high resolution if available.

height.description: Height of the patient in centimeters.

weight.description: Weight of the patient in kilograms.

year_of_birth.description: Year of birth of the patient.

waiting_since.description: Date since when the patient has been on waiting list. Use format YYYY-MM-DD.

internal_medical_id.description: Custom medical ID that will not be shown in UI, but will be stored and can be seen in patient xlsx export.

name.description: HLA antibody name in high (A\*01:01), low (A\*01), split (A1) or broad (A9) resolutions. In case of DP or DQ, when alpha and beta are provided, the expected format is DQ[01:01,02:02]

mfi.description: Mean fluorescence intensity. Use exact value.

cutoff.description: Default cutoff value for the specific patient and HLA antibody.

recipients_uploaded.description: Number of recipients successfully loaded into the application.

donors_uploaded.description: Number of donors successfully loaded into the application.

parsing_errors.description: Errors and warnings that occurred in HLA codes parsing

email.description: Email of the user to login.

second_factor.description: 2FA: Phone number for user account in standard format (see example), IP address for SERVICE account.

allowed_countries.description: Countries that the user has access to.

environment.description: Environment the code was build for.

detailed_score_per_group.description:
Contains details for compatibility index for each HLA Group compatibility
index is calculated for.

internal_medical_id.description: Internal medical id of the patient

related_donor_db_id.description: Database id of the related donor

hla_per_groups.description: hla types split to hla groups

hla_antibodies_per_groups.description: hla antibodies split to hla groups

active.description: Whether the user shall be used in pairing calculation

internal_medical_id.description: Internal medical id of the patient

related_recipient_db_id.description: Database id of the related recipient

compatible_blood_with_related_recipient.description: Indicator whether Donor and related recipients have compatible blood groups

detailed_score_with_related_recipient.description:
Contains details for compatibility index for each HLA Group compatibility
index is calculated for.

acceptable_blood_groups.description: Provide full list of all the acceptable blood groups of the patient, not just the change set

hla_antibodies.description: Provide full list of all the HLA antibodies of the patient, not just the change set

recipient_requirements.description: Provide the whole recipients requirements object, it will be overwritten

waiting_since.description: Date since when the patient has been on waiting list. Use format YYYY-MM-DD.

hla_typing.description: Provide full list of all the HLA types of the patient, not just the change set

active.description: Information, whether or not given donor shall be considered in exchange.

ParseError.description: When a mask can't be parsed

MaskError.description: When any error occurs on mask
